decks.notes: The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive threats and overwhelm the opponent. With an emphasis on efficient creature removal and disruptive spells, the deck aims to control the board while pushing damage through with powerful threats like Archfiend of the Dross and Mosswood Dreadknight. The inclusion of mana acceleration creatures like Llanowar Elves allows for explosive starts and the ability to cast larger threats ahead of schedule. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game to secure a swift victory.

The main idea of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Questing Druid, alongside powerful spells such as Lightning Strike and Burst Lightning, the deck aims to deal quick and consistent damage to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Emberheart Challenger and Heartfire Hero further enhances the deck's aggressive capabilities. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining board presence and applying pressure to secure a swift victory.

This UW Control deck focuses on stalling and disrupting the opponent's game plan through removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. The key strategy is to control the board early with cards like Day of Judgment and Ride's End, then maintain the advantage with cards like Three Steps Ahead and Temporary Lockdown. Later in the game, the deck aims to out-value the opponent with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Mistmoors and card advantage engines like Stock Up and Meticulous Archive. The mana base is designed to provide consistency and support the high number of double-colored mana requirements in the deck.
